html: I don't believe here in DC we know better than the local elected officials or the local tribes. We can only resolve these issues by deescalating the divisiveness, the ‘winner-take-all’ philosophy, and sitting down with the various interest groups as we did in San Juan County.
text: I don't believe here in DC we know better than the local elected officials or the local tribes. We can only resolve these issues by deescalating the divisiveness, the ‘winner-take-all’ philosophy, and sitting down with the various interest groups as we did in San Juan County.

html: I’m absolutely convinced there’s a strong desire in Utah among the elected officials and the constituents to protect and preserve these very important and scared areas. That’s never been in question. What has been in question, is who gets to make those decisions?
text: I’m absolutely convinced there’s a strong desire in Utah among the elected officials and the constituents to protect and preserve these very important and scared areas. That’s never been in question. What has been in question, is who gets to make those decisions?

html: Today I was pleased to see that the "End Banking for Human Traffickers Act of 2019" a bill I sponsored, passed the House Foreign Affairs Committee. The legislation will create global norms for preventing financial transactions connected to human trafficking. #utpol #utleg

html: Just two days after the passage of Utah’s women’s suffrage bill, Salt Lake City held a municipal election that provided Utah’s newly-enfranchised women an immediate opportunity to exercise their right to vote, making them the first women to vote since the suffrage movement began.
text: Just two days after the passage of Utah’s women’s suffrage bill, Salt Lake City held a municipal election that provided Utah’s newly-enfranchised women an immediate opportunity to exercise their right to vote, making them the first women to vote since the suffrage movement began.

html: I'm proud to wear yellow today to celebrate 149 years of women's suffrage. On February 14, 1870, 25 Utah women voted, marking women’s first vote under suffrage laws that we would recognize today. #utpol #utlegpic.twitter.com/3cESwPkA3b

html: Join my Clean Air Challenge: -I will consolidate vehicle trips & reduce my family's total driving -I will park and walk instead of using drive-up windows -I will not let my vehicle idle for more than 30 secs, even in the cold -I will ride my bike, car-pool, or use public transit
text:
Join my Clean Air Challenge:
-I will consolidate vehicle trips & reduce my family's total driving
-I will park and walk instead of using drive-up windows
-I will not let my vehicle idle for more than 30 secs, even in the cold
-I will ride my bike, car-pool, or use public transit

html: On Title IV changes: “We must do everything we can to protect men and women who are victims of sexually assault. If we’re erring, we need to be erring on the side of the victims.”
text: On Title IV changes: “We must do everything we can to protect men and women who are victims of sexually assault. If we’re erring, we need to be erring on the side of the victims.”

html: "I think it’s important that we quickly resolve that. The economy is healthy and it’s absorbing these problems, but both of these things introduce uncertainty into the market place, which is what we’re seeing in the stock market.” (2/2)
text: "I think it’s important that we quickly resolve that. The economy is healthy and it’s absorbing these problems, but both of these things introduce uncertainty into the market place, which is what we’re seeing in the stock market.” (2/2)

html: On the economy: "Utah is resilient, but the economy in the nation is more fragile. Watching the tariffs and the trade war going on; I'm actually more concerned about that impact on the economy than the shutdown." (1/2)
text: On the economy: "Utah is resilient, but the economy in the nation is more fragile. Watching the tariffs and the trade war going on; I'm actually more concerned about that impact on the economy than the shutdown." (1/2)

html: On unpaid, furloughed government workers: “I walked through TSA this morning and I was embarrassed. It’s not a good situation in any way, shape, or form— and that’s why I’m here, working with my colleagues, and searching for the answer myself that ends this."
text: On unpaid, furloughed government workers: “I walked through TSA this morning and I was embarrassed. It’s not a good situation in any way, shape, or form— and that’s why I’m here, working with my colleagues, and searching for the answer myself that ends this."

html: On the Mueller investigation: "Those that do or do not support the President should want this investigation to be carried through. It’s in our nation’s best interest to be resolved." (2/2)
text: On the Mueller investigation: "Those that do or do not support the President should want this investigation to be carried through. It’s in our nation’s best interest to be resolved." (2/2)

html: On the Mueller investigation: "I am waiting, with great anticipation, for Mueller to finish the investigation & give us the facts. The reality is, we have a faction of the information at our fingertips." (1/2)
text: On the Mueller investigation: "I am waiting, with great anticipation, for Mueller to finish the investigation & give us the facts. The reality is, we have a faction of the information at our fingertips." (1/2)

html: On the shutdown: “You can blame the President all you want, but this is Congress’ fault. We wouldn’t be here if we’d done our job and funded the government. At the end of the day, Congress has to look in the mirror and say, ‘We own this. This is our fault.’”
text: On the shutdown: “You can blame the President all you want, but this is Congress’ fault. We wouldn’t be here if we’d done our job and funded the government. At the end of the day, Congress has to look in the mirror and say, ‘We own this. This is our fault.’”

html: "Right now, we don’t have the resources at the border. If you'll remember when 7,000 people showed up, we simply could not process them because we hadn’t invested in our border. We’ve got to put the resources there." (2/2)
text: "Right now, we don’t have the resources at the border. If you'll remember when 7,000 people showed up, we simply could not process them because we hadn’t invested in our border. We’ve got to put the resources there." (2/2)

html: On asylum: “People have been asking for a long time for the ability to seek asylum in their own country, so they don’t have to make the dangerous journey up to the border. This would be a good thing." (1/2)
text: On asylum: “People have been asking for a long time for the ability to seek asylum in their own country, so they don’t have to make the dangerous journey up to the border. This would be a good thing." (1/2)

html: On opioids: "In Utah we lead the country in a statistic we should not be proud of: the highest rate of opioid addictions in pregnant women. That's why I introduced the POPPY study act- to find alternatives we have to pain and treatments." MORE:https://bit.ly/2FJ88lV
text: On opioids: "In Utah we lead the country in a statistic we should not be proud of: the highest rate of opioid addictions in pregnant women. That's why I introduced the POPPY study act- to find alternatives we have to pain and treatments." MORE:https://bit.ly/2FJ88lV

html: On a wall: “Judges, facilities, boots on the ground, technology, all of these have great bipartisan support. Until recently, some type of barrier did have bipartisan support as well. The answer is far broader than a wall. But we as a county must be willing to invest in security."
text: On a wall: “Judges, facilities, boots on the ground, technology, all of these have great bipartisan support. Until recently, some type of barrier did have bipartisan support as well. The answer is far broader than a wall. But we as a county must be willing to invest in security."

html: The American people expect Congress to do its most basic job: pass a budget and fund the government. If we can’t, then we shouldn’t get paid. Today I introduced H.R. 26, the "No Work, No Pay Act of 2019." My bill would prohibit Congress from being paid during government shutdowns
text: The American people expect Congress to do its most basic job: pass a budget and fund the government. If we can’t, then we shouldn’t get paid. Today I introduced H.R. 26, the "No Work, No Pay Act of 2019." My bill would prohibit Congress from being paid during government shutdowns

html: The people in rural Utah know how to work hard and work smart, which is what is needed. It will take a joint effort to make economic growth happen here in our rural communities. As individuals, institutions & companies in rural Utah there is much that can be done. #ruralbizsummit

html: I’ve talked to many people in our rural counties & most of them tell me that they want to stay here. They love the life they have here & want their children to live here & their grandchildren. To do this, we must have good jobs available—jobs that pay enough to support a family.
text: I’ve talked to many people in our rural counties & most of them tell me that they want to stay here. They love the life they have here & want their children to live here & their grandchildren. To do this, we must have good jobs available—jobs that pay enough to support a family.

html: In deciding to create the #ruralbizsummit we thought of 5 specific areas that could promote economic development: 1-Transport rural workers to the Wasatch front, 2-Remote workers, 3-Expand Wasatch front businesses into rural Utah, 4-Expand local companies, & 5-Be an Entrepreneurpic.twitter.com/8MWHNhRZjd

html: I quickly learned that the concerns in our rural counties are very different from those along the Wasatch front. Early on, I made it one of my primary missions, to do what I could to bring some success to the rural areas of our district. #ruralbizsummit

html: I have held over 100 town hall meetings all over the district—including dozens of visits to the rural counties—which I have found to be very helpful in understanding what concerns exist in the district. I work for you and need your input to be effective. #ruralbizsummit

html: I hope today we can provide resources for how Utah industries and businesses can deal with tariffs and to weather this trade war with China. #intltradeconf
text: I hope today we can provide resources for how Utah industries and businesses can deal with tariffs and to weather this trade war with China. #intltradeconf

html: I strongly believe that nobody wins a trade war—we are already starting to see the casualties of this trade war with China and these tariffs are just barely starting to be fully implemented. #intltradeconfpic.twitter.com/aNLn7o7lDL
text: I strongly believe that nobody wins a trade war—we are already starting to see the casualties of this trade war with China and these tariffs are just barely starting to be fully implemented. #intltradeconfpic.twitter.com/aNLn7o7lDL

html: I am strong proponent of free trade and free market principles. #intltradeconf
text: I am strong proponent of free trade and free market principles. #intltradeconf

html: I believe that Congress needs to play a stronger role in determining American trade policy. #intltradeconfpic.twitter.com/THCVnaeLeC
text: I believe that Congress needs to play a stronger role in determining American trade policy. #intltradeconfpic.twitter.com/THCVnaeLeC

html: I am an original cosponsor of H.R. 6337, which would require Congressional approval before the President adjusts tariffs on imports that are determined to threaten to impair national security. #intltradeconf
text: I am an original cosponsor of H.R. 6337, which would require Congressional approval before the President adjusts tariffs on imports that are determined to threaten to impair national security. #intltradeconf

html: Congress passed reforms to the Committee on Foreign Investment. This reform gives more control to the US government to review & potentially block foreign investments into sectors of the US economy important to national security or critical sectors of the US economy #intltradeconf
text: Congress passed reforms to the Committee on Foreign Investment. This reform gives more control to the US government to review & potentially block foreign investments into sectors of the US economy important to national security or critical sectors of the US economy #intltradeconf

html: I have heard from dozens of Utah companies and industries being crushed by the tariffs on imported products from China as well as the retaliatory tariffs on American exports. I’d like to share what Congress and I am doing about it. #intltradeconf
text: I have heard from dozens of Utah companies and industries being crushed by the tariffs on imported products from China as well as the retaliatory tariffs on American exports. I’d like to share what Congress and I am doing about it. #intltradeconf

html: The part of the #PoleCreekFire that jumped north of Highway 6 is 0% contained. The highway is still closed to through traffic. As of early reports today, over 90,000 acres have burned. Crews are going direct, where possible, to slow the forward progress of the fire.
text: The part of the #PoleCreekFire that jumped north of Highway 6 is 0% contained. The highway is still closed to through traffic. As of early reports today, over 90,000 acres have burned. Crews are going direct, where possible, to slow the forward progress of the fire.

html: There are about 1200 firefighters working both the #PoleCreekFire & #BaldMountainFire. Indirect dozer lines & handlines have been trenched along the borders of both Woodland Hills & Elk Ridge. Residents in those cities should still plan on other accommodations for two weeks.
text: There are about 1200 firefighters working both the #PoleCreekFire & #BaldMountainFire. Indirect dozer lines & handlines have been trenched along the borders of both Woodland Hills & Elk Ridge. Residents in those cities should still plan on other accommodations for two weeks.

html: Arches and Canyonlands have a combined maintenance backlog over $65M. These parks are local economic drivers and treasures that should be there for future generations. I'm proud to support the Restore Our Parks and Public Lands Act to help #FixOurParks. #utpolpic.twitter.com/4oxz1UjBAH
text: Arches and Canyonlands have a combined maintenance backlog over $65M. These parks are local economic drivers and treasures that should be there for future generations. I'm proud to support the Restore Our Parks and Public Lands Act to help #FixOurParks. #utpolpic.twitter.com/4oxz1UjBAH

html: The Rural Broadband Permitting Efficiency Act addresses some of these challenges by: —Empowering states to speed up broadband permitting —Bringing efficiency and costs savings to broadband deployment Glad to see this bill pass the House tonight. #ruralbroadband
text:
The Rural Broadband Permitting Efficiency Act addresses some of these challenges by:
 
—Empowering states to speed up broadband permitting  
—Bringing efficiency and costs savings to broadband deployment
 
Glad to see this bill pass the House tonight. #ruralbroadband

html: The Restore Our Parks & Public Lands Act creates a dedicated fund to pay down the maintenance backlog. $1.3 billion each year for 5 years. Repairs crippling park infrastructure. Saves national parks for generations to come. #FixOurParkspic.twitter.com/XQXTV7vSSK
text:
The Restore Our Parks & Public Lands Act creates a dedicated fund to pay down the maintenance backlog. 

 $1.3 billion each year for 5 years.
 Repairs crippling park infrastructure. 
 Saves national parks for generations to come. 
#FixOurParkspic.twitter.com/XQXTV7vSSK

html: By helping our rural communities gain access to high-speed Internet we can ensure efficiencies for critical economic development opportunities. I am delighted to see this bill move forward and grateful for allies like @senorrinhatch that have been championing this important bill.

html: We all feel a connection to 9/11, and mine is being one of the passengers in the air during the event and my close up visit just a few short weeks after 9/11. May we never forget that fateful day. https://curtis.house.gov/blog/where-were-you-on-9-11/ …pic.twitter.com/eb88j67peJ
text: We all feel a connection to 9/11, and mine is being one of the passengers in the air during the event and my close up visit just a few short weeks after 9/11. May we never forget that fateful day. https://curtis.house.gov/blog/where-were-you-on-9-11/ …pic.twitter.com/eb88j67peJ

html: We walked the ghost town streets of Manhattan and strolled within a few feet of Ground Zero. As I look back I wonder why I took almost no pictures but I seem to remember almost a reverence for the area that was not conducive to acting like a tourist.
text: We walked the ghost town streets of Manhattan and strolled within a few feet of Ground Zero. As I look back I wonder why I took almost no pictures but I seem to remember almost a reverence for the area that was not conducive to acting like a tourist.

html: Before 9/11 I had scheduled a trip to meet in early October with the @NYPDnews and planned to take my children with me. My tickets fell in that strange period when they would not refund the tickets so we made the trip.
text: Before 9/11 I had scheduled a trip to meet in early October with the @NYPDnews and planned to take my children with me. My tickets fell in that strange period when they would not refund the tickets so we made the trip.

html: My first trip to visit the Hopi Tribe certainly won’t be my last. I thoroughly enjoyed getting to spend the day with Vice Chairman Tenakhongva and tribal leaders to learn about their unique culture. I look forward to working together and a continued dialogue on important issues.pic.twitter.com/JOPIIUmVWn

html: #NetNeutrality can be a touchy subject. That's partly why we were honored to be invited to a roundtable discussion by US Congressman @RepJohnCurtis on the topic. Others at the table were from Facebook, Qualtrics, AT&T, Dell EMC, Adobe, & ISPs. https://blog.mainframe.com/net-neutrality-roundtable-with-us-congressman-john-curtis-837d789be7f3 … #freedom
